intro: Pseudima costaricense, commonly known as the Costa Rican pseudima, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy coating, while its stems are hairy and sturdy. The flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects.
